column1: gets it straight and on a good length, Guptill pats it to mid-on
he's got some shape going away from the batsman, but this is slightly back of a length, which allows Guptill to glide it off an open bat face to third man
some movement in the air but ends up too full, low full toss outside off, punched to cover
the famous Malinga yorker - swinging into the batsman and at the toes. Munro digs it out back to the bowler
another yorker length ball, flicked to mid-on
went round the wicket for the last ball, but angled in a bit too much, and he flicks it off his pads to fine leg
good length, angling across the left-hander. He defends it solidly from the crease

punched on the up and past cover. The timing on that was so good it's gone to the fence. It seemed like they would just get one run, but the combination of a quick outfield and good timing meant the ball just beats the fielder to the fence
driven off the front foot again, but straighter that time, and Malinga tumbles to his right at mid-off to stop the ball
back of a length and going across, he stays on the back foot that time and slashes it, but straight to point
another back of length ball going across, he wanted to slap it through cover, but didn't get hold of it. Ends up under-edging it towards mid-off. They go through for a quick run
straight and on a good length, Guptill shuffles across and pats it towards mid-on

up and over the infield fuller on off stump, Munro brings out the pick-up shot. Doesn't get the timing quite right, and sends it very high. It hits the signboard on the midwicket fence on the full. Initially given a four, but the umpires check the replay and give it as maximum
fuller, strays on the pads, clipped to square leg.
on the pads again and turned towards square leg. Placed to the fielder's left so they go through for a single
good length, some shape away from the batsman. Guptill gets behind it and steers it towards point
shaping away again, but very full length. Tapped towards mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, Guptill goes back and punches it towards midwicket for a quick single
fuller outside off, driven to cover
good length on the stumps, shows the full face of the bat to defend it back
gorgeoustakes a half step down the track, transfers weight seamlessly on the front foot and creams this through cover with a textbook cover drive.
good length outside off, defended
too full and too straight, Guptill comes forward to clip it to midwicket. Closed his bat face to place it in the gap

good work from Kusal Perera on the third man fence. This was another bit of peachy timing from Guptill, who came forward and drove it past point. But some quick running by the fielder meant the ball was picked up inside the fence
yorker length, swinging in. Munro goes for the drive, but ends up getting the end of the bat on it. The ball bounces down and goes to slip

taken by point Munro too early into the drive. It was the off-cutter, and flies off the leading edge. Sandakan at point dives and takes the ball, but they want to check with the third umpire. Soft signal is out. Munro stayed put initially. Looks like the ball has been caught cleanly, with a finger under the ball, so he'll have to go on his way. Third umpire Richard Illingworth agrees, 'no conclusive evidence to over-turn the soft signal' he says. Cleverly bowled by Malinga, having drawn him into driving, but bowling the off-cutter to take the leading edge. Munro will be disappointed at not building on his start
what was that! No-ball and free hit coming up, that just slipped out of Malinga's hands and went past Williamson's head down the leg side. Malinga holds up his hand to apologise.

great ball for a free hit, but Williamson is going to get runs for it anyway, with an edge between keeper and slip. Bounced after taking the edge, and the keeper got a glove on it, but was unable to stop it, diving to his right
good length ball on the stumps, defended
take a picture of that and frame it back of a length and given some room outside off, and Williamson leans into the cover drive effortlessly, sends it to the fence
fuller ball on the stumps, Williamson opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man
very full and very straight, he stays back and turns it to deep square leg
strays on the pads again, and Williamson clips it nicely, but straight to midwicket
good length, but well outside off, and he lets it go through
good bouncer, just in the channel outside off and getting big on Williamson. He thought about cutting it but swayed out of the way

edge goes past slip for four good length in the channel, moving away a touch perhaps. Williamson played it with soft hands though, so even though the bowler drew the poke, the ball dropped well short of the slip, and too much to his right for him to stop it
good length on the stumps, blocked back
back of a length on off, Guptill pushes it towards mid-off.
too much width and Guptill launches into that. Well outside off, he gets down on one knee and frees his arms to smash this over cover for a boundary
good length outside off, he comes forward to defend towards point
back of a length, keeping it in the channel. Guptill pushes it gently towards point
good length, straighter. Guptill goes across to try and clip it on the leg side, but doesn't connect well
fuller and straight, Guptill comes forward and pushes it past the bowler. They take a quick single. Mid-off has a shy at the stumps but misses. Would have been interesting if he had hit
too full on off, and Guptill picks it up to flick it over midwicket for another boundary
given room outside off and he slashes at it, but straight to point
very full outside off, driven firmly, but straight to mid-on
good length on the stumps, Guptill moves across and pats it to mid-on
smashed keeps it very full outside off, and Guptill just smashes it through the line, sends it past the bowler, and Malinga diving to his right at mid-off can't even get a hand to it

take that he's just dismissed this. Given some room outside off, with the ball too short and he cuts it powerfully past point to send it crashing into the fence. Guptill's racing off, as are New Zealand
length ball, but straying on the pads, and Williamson gets inside the line to flick it to fine leg
good length on the stumps, he moves across and flicks it to midwicket. Played with soft hands, so they have enough time for a quick single
good length on off stump, he tried to punch it, but gets a thick inside edge that goes to midwicket
good length outside off, he comes on the front foot to defend it towards midwicket
keeps it on a good length around off stump, not giving Williamson room and tucking him up. Played back to the bowler
good length and tight line again, Williamson defends off the front foot
given some air outside off, driven to cover off the front foot
bowled from wide of the stumps and angling in, strikes him on the pads. Clearly missing leg, but the bowler went up in vociferous appeal
he's not reading the leggie. Stays back and this pops off the leading edge towards the bowler, but well short
comes down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and clips it to midwicket
wide outside off, he cuts it but straight to point
given some air outside off, Williamson defends it gently. Quick call from Guptill for a single and they run it well

oooh peachy from Williamson. Such great timing, and this is a super fast outfield. Given just a bit of room outside off and the ball is just a little short. He rocks back and steers it past point, and into the fence
gets it more straight and fuller, clipped to mid-on
strays on the pads that time, and Williamson flicks to deep square leg. There is a fielder there though, so they get only one run
fuller on the stumps, gets nicely behind it to block it back to the bowler
strays on the pads again, tucked towards midwicket, but can't go past the fielder
oooh, that goes past the outside edge. Pitched on a length and moved away. Guptill was stuck in his crease and ends up feeling for it with his hands.
tossed up outside off, too full though and Williamson flat bats it past the bowler
too short and too wide, Guptill pounces. Stays back and cuts this to the fence with great timing. Waited for it and was perfectly balanced while playing it
too full outside off, and driven firmly to wide long-off

amazing shot from Williamson quicker ball that was angled into him. He almost mis-read it, but moved back and punched it crisply in time to send it to the cover fence. The feilder had to run across and field it
gets some drift and beats the bat, strikes him on the pad. Another appeal, but with that wide of the stumps angle and drift, that is always missing leg
full outside off, he gets down to sweep it and picks it up well, to send it to fine leg
too straight and moving away, ends up on the pads. Flicked to fine leg
fuller length in the channel outside off. He goes hard at it and gets a thick edge that goes to third man. Not where he was intending to send it
good length on the stumps, wristed to mid-on

very full on the stumps, patted gently to mid-off and they take a quick single. Would have been risky if Gunaratne at mid-off had hit the stumps. He ran in and swooped on the ball but missed the stumps by a whisker
good length outside of, defended towards point
keeps it on a very tight line, just outside off and a non-drivable length. Defended into the off side again
angling into him from wide of the stumps again. A touch too full, on off, defended
better line and length, draws him on the front foot to defend
given some air on off, good length, but he goes well back in his crease to clip to long-on
googly, spinning back into him from outside off, punched back
flatter, and Guptill had come down the track to meet it, but couldn't get to the pitch of the ball. Hit on the pads but was too far down for the bowler to even appeal
brings out the slog sweep but doesn't connect. Hit on the pads again, another appeal but this is sliding down leg too
tossed up from over the wicket on leg stump. clipped back to the bowler
tossed up on middle stump, he steps out and gives himself room to drive inside out past extra cover
nicely tossed up on a good length, on the stumps, draws him on the front foot to defend
tossed up again, but on the pads, and worked away to deep midwicket
given some air, but too full, and he stays leg side of the ball to drive it to long-off
flatter on the stumps, but he goes deep in his crease to whip it to deep midwicket
tossed up on off, he comes forward to drive it to long-on
getting some drift into the batsman again, and beats his forward press to take the inside edge onto pad
tossed up but too full, and driven to long-off
comes down the track, but the bowler pulls his length back. He's forced to defend it into the leg side
strays on the pads, and is clipped to midwicket. No fielder there, so the bowler runs across to field himself
given some air outside off, but a bit too short. Williamson stays back and cuts it with the turn to deep point. And that will be drinks
tossed up, on middle stump. Williamson is stick to his strategy of driving through the off side by giving himself room
bowls this wider outside off and is flat-batted to long-off
good length, holding up a touch. He waits on it and punches it past the bowler
fuller on the stumps, wristed back to the bowler
too full and across the batsman, outside off, driven comfortably to long-off
tossed up on the stumps, and Williamson goes inside out again, this time to long-off
tossed up on off, not much turn either way, defended off the front foot
short and skids in on off, punched away past the right of Prasanna for one
shorter and slides on with the arm outside off, steered away wide enough for third man
back of a length on the hips, hangs back and whips it out to deep midwicket
slides in with the arm from over the wicket, knocked away to the leg side for another hard-run single

Prasanna dangles it up outside off, full, Guptill extends his hands and launches it up and over extra-cover and into the grassbanks. Guptill brings up his fifty in style. He takes NZ past 100 too. All in one blow. Welcome back, Martin!
low full-toss on leg stump, knocked down to long-on for one
tossed up and breaks away outside off, wrong'un? carved away to point
fuller and middle and leg, tapped away to the right of midwicket
floats a full-toss on middle, punched away to the left of a diving short cover
really full on middle and leg, Williamson twirls his wrists and drives to long-on
darted short and wide outside off, Guptill reaches out for the ball and crunnnnnnnches a cut away behind point. There's no stopping that
Top shot, Kane. He's matching Guptill shot for shot. He twinkles down the track and cracks it against the intended break over midwicket
shorter and slides on outside off, Kane simply runs it down to deep third man
pushed through on middle and leg, worked quietly through square leg
non-turner outside off, drilled through the line to the covers
back of a length and slides in at off, forced back to the bowler off the back foot
fast skidder on off, keeps a bit low, punched down to long-on off the back foot
full stock back, turns in, blocked back
full and on the pads, neatly clipped away to deep midwicket
another stock ball, breaks back in, grazes the inside edge and rolls away to the leg side
darted full on the pads, dragged away to square leg with a flat sweep
Sandakan lobs a full-toss on leg stump, Guptill drops down to one knee and nails a sweep. Deposits it into the grassbanks beyond square leg. Boom
speared on the pads, full, flicked away to wide long-on
back of a length on middle, whipped away to deep midwicket
banged in short and down leg, barely 135ks, leg-side wide
Kane rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers to deep third man
short and cramps Guptill for room. He steers it only as far as the keeper
back of a length on off, cramped for room again, dinked to point
very full and on leg stump, Guptill closes the face and ends up wafting it back to Malinga
118ks offcutter outside off, Guptill reads the change-up and bunts a single to mid-off hanging back
Kane stretches out, takes a middle-stump full-toss and turns it between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Artistic flick. Well played, Kane Williamson. He brings up a fifty at his home ground
skidding into the pads, worked off the back foot to square leg
possibly a googly that breaks away, sliced off the outside half to the covers
really full and outside off, belted to the covers
flatter and outside off, prodded to the covers off the front foot by Guptill
tossed outside off, Guptill props forward and eases it down to long-off
banged in short on off, hangs back and whips it away past the right of midwicket
Malinga ventures the big dipper, but drifts down leg
follows the dipper with a inswinging yorker, on off, Guptill jabs his bat down and keeps it out. Malinga still has it
overpitched on off, Williamson shows the full face of the bat and drives it back to the bowler. Malinga stretches his right leg and stops the ball
Williamson allows this slower 116ks ball to come onto him outside off, then dabs it wide enough past the keeper to find a single
fuller and outside off, Guptill belts it away to long-on. Hit hard but just a single for Guptill
pitched up and outside off, Williamson deliberately opens the face to drive it in the gap at the covers
Williamson steps out and drives a full-toss on leg stump down to long-on
skids on middle, punched up to long-off
skids on middle, speared down to long-on
fuller on leg stump, swept away to square leg
full on middle and leg, forced to the right of the bowler, who dives to his right to intercept the ball
pushed through outside off, eased down to long-off
and Guptill dents his figures right away. Very full and very wide outside off, carved up and over point
on a length and outside off, whisked away to the midwicket region
Guptill stands up tall to this short ball outside off and punches through the line but can't pierce the off-side infield
Williamson now stands up tall and punches through the line to sweeper cover to raise the 150 for NZ
flies away to the left of sweeper cover. Short, wide, Guptill throws his bat at the ball but can't find the boundary
slower ball outside off, skewed off the inside half to deep midwicket. Misfield in the outfield
back of a length and kicks up at off, fended back to the bowler. Welcome back, Asela
really full on the pads, clipped past the right of midwicket. Looks like an offroller
short and floated on off, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and on middle, pumped to long-on off the back foot
slower offcutter, finishes on middle, Williamson secures a single down to long-on
shortish around off, dabbed behind square on the off side towards third man
shortish and outside off, punched through the line to the covers
Williamson gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches square through the off side. Crsip
short, wide, Guptill smears it away to sweeper cover
really full on off, whipped down to long-on from crease
short on off, Thisara cramps the batsman for room, punched down to long-on
Williamson shuffles across off and pushes a full ball on off to long-on

gorgeous shot from Williamson. Tossed up and angling across off, he back away, collapses his back leg and hoists it inside-out over extra-cover. He just needed to lift it to clear the infield and he does it with so much ease
full on the stumps, pushed back to Danushka
and again! This is top-quality batting from Williamson. Full and on middle, he collapses his back leg again and lifts this inside-out over wide mid-off now. He's manipulating the field like a boss
whipped off the hips to deep midwicket
darted outside leg, had Guptill left it it might have been a wide, instead he shovels to square leg
full-toss on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
Prasanna drops short on off, Guptill goes back and slog-pulls it to the square-leg fence
slower legbreak, popped to the left of the diving bowler
short and slides in on off, punched down to long-on
pushed through on off, defended back
googly, faster and shorter, forced to deep midwicket
on a length and pushed wider outside off, chopped towards short third man
drifts onto the pads and glanced away fine on the leg side
lifter on off, Guptill ducks under it carefully
short on the hips, cramps the batsman for room, flapped away to deep square leg
back of a length on off, Williamson runs it away behind point
dug in short on middle, swatted away to deep midwicket

Pradeep returns and provides SL with the breakthrough. Chopped on. Williamson throws his head back in frustration. Shortish and slants in at off, Kane is pretty adept at knocking these down late to deep third man. He's already done it a few times in this innings. But this one cramps him further for room and he can only send a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. The second-wicket stands ends at 163 - 17 short of the NZ record.
tossed on off, tipped to point off the front foot
chopped away behind point. A misfield ensues but just a single
Taylor ventures down the track and taps it away to the left of short cover
darted short and outside off, stabbed away to extra cover
slower and fuller on off, nudged through the midwicket region
Taylor steps out, Prasanna sees it and shortens his length. Taylor pads it away
bouncer on middle, Guptill ducks under it
pitched up on off, driven on the up to short cover
throat-hunting short ball on off, Guptill looks away and fends it away to the leg side
full and coming in on middle and leg, Taylor plays around his front pad and works it away to the leg side
back of a length and angling in at off, punched back
Guptill rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers it to deep third man
fuller length outside off, flatter. Defended off the front foot
gets some drift, but it ends up on the pads. He shuffles across to whip it, but doesn't connect well

century No.14 for Martin Guptill this was thrown up wide, inviting the drive and Guptill nailed it, smashing it through cover from one knee to get to his century in style. He's been hardly troubled today
tapped back to mid-on
slightly short outside off, chops to point
flatter outside off, he comes forward to get to the pitch of the ball and steers it to point. They think about a quick single but decide against it
tossed up, too full on leg stump, picked off his toes, but can't go past midwicket
and there's the Taylor sweep. His favourite shot, and he connects well, taking this ball from leg stump and sweeping hard against the turn to the deep square leg boundary

beauty googly, pitches on leg, draws Taylor forward and spins past the bat. An excitable Dickwella whips the bails off and appeals. For some reason the square leg umpire goes up to the third umpire. Taylor's leg was well in.
tossed up on leg stump again, and Taylor gets to the pitch of the ball to clip it past midwicket
goes across the batsman and ends up well outside off. Guptill square drives to deep cover
tossed up and wide of off stump, slapped to deep cover
given some air, good length outside off and turning away a bit, he stays inside the line and guides it past point

don't need a ticket for that, it'll get where it has to with air miles he's absolutely smashed the cover off the ball with a slog-sweep, picking it up from outside off, while it was drifting away and full. Sends it sailing over midwicket, deep into the crowd
that shot has made him bowl it much wider outside off. Guptill stays in his crease and slashes it, but Malinga at point, tumbles and saves
goes back that time and pushes it to mid-on
fuller on off, Taylor tries to work it away to the leg side, but doesn't get much bat on it
drifting down leg and takes the pad down to fine leg, Taylor missing out on connecting with the flick
fuller on off, driven fluently to long off
tossed up and full on middle stump, Guptill keeps his bat straight and drives past the bowler
going across the right hander, and Taylor stays in his crease to chop it to deep point
fuller outside off, he waits for it and late cuts it to third man
flatter on leg stump, moves across to whip it, but straight to midwicket
fuller, going across the right-hander again, Guptill drives it with a horizontal bat almost, but finds mid-off
good bouncer first up, over leg stump, forcing the batsman to duck underneath after he was initially shaping to pull it
some shape away from the batsman, but ends up almost a half-volley outside off, and he glides it to deep point
good length ball on off, slower ball. Guptill didn't quite pick it, came forward to push it a little early, it ends up hitting him high on the bat and dropping in front
back of a length outside off, another slower ball. Guptill is a little early into his punch again, but manages to get it down to long-off
good length on the stumps, he stays on the back foot and tucks it to deep square leg

back of a length outside off, he's bowling a succession of 115-120 kph balls to Guptill. He stays on the back foot and whips it to long-on, early into the shot again and that hung in the air for a bit, but was safe
too short, spinning across the batsman from leg stump, he gets down on his knees to pull it to deep midwicket
beats him with the googly again. spinning across him and continues going that way, Taylor went for the big drive but didn't connect. The ball stopped a bit too
pitches on leg stump and beats his slog sweep. He seemed to get an edge onto pad but its given as leg byes
goes deep in his crease to work it to deep square leg

this is bowled wide of off stump, across the batsman, Guptill goes down on one knee and swats it over long-off. Didn't really time it well but it's a short boundary and he hit it powerfully enough to clear it easily
length ball on the stumps, punched back to the bowler
short ball, on off stump, passes by at shoulder height. Taylor went for the pull but connected only with air
oh he lost control of that one again. He did it to Kane Williamson early on, this one goes at chest height down leg side. Taylor gets some bat on it to send it to the fine leg fence
full ball outside off, ends up as a low full toss. Taylor went hard at it, but hits it straight to mid-off
back of a length outside off, he stays on the back foot to flat bat it past the bowler
down leg side again, and that will be a wide
back of a length on the stumps, Taylor stays in his crease, goes on the back foot and taps it to midwicket
too short outside off, he saw that coming and it sat up nicely. Swivels to pull it to the deep midwicket fence
good length on the stumps, he stays in his crease to tuck it to fine leg
good length on the stumps, turning into the right hander, patted back to the bowler
that kept low. On a good length again and spinning in, Guptill was watching it so was able to get his bat down in time to jab it out. Went at calf height
another one disappears wide outside off and Guptill goes over long-off from down on one knee again.
sweeps this fine to pick up a single
full outside off, and dug out to point's right
down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball on leg stump and whips it to the midwicket fence. A diving effort prevents the boundary
too wide and he throws his bat at it, connects well but there is a man at deep cover
fuller on off, and swatted to long-on
mis-hit six, caught in the crowdangling into Taylor, who moves across to whip it, gets a leading edge almost but it has enough on it to go past deep square leg!
full outside off and shovelled away, but straight to mid-on

full toss that's leathered to deep midwicket. Asela down there tries to dive, but that would have been a spectacular catch if he had taken it. It's hit too hard and too fast though. One bounce into the fence

no-ball for full toss above waist height the Sri Lankan bowlers are losing their grip - on the ball and the match. This one ends up as a full toss above waist, and it's hit to mid-on. Will be a free hit
free hit goes for six would you believe it, that's another full toss. Taylor doesn't miss out, smashing the cover off it and sending it over wide long-on with a horizontal bat
back of a length and a tight line outside off, Guptill tentatively pushes it off the back foot

he's out to a leading edge caught at point great knock, but it's come to a tame end. Guptill seemed caught on the crease. Another good length ball and on off stump, he looked like he wanted to flick it. Perhaps it bounced more than it expected. He was late in bringing the bat down too, and it flies off the leading edge for a straightforward catch. Some relief for Sri Lanka
fuller ball on off, angled across, gets it right off the middle of the bat to drive it past extra cover
good length, coming back into the batsman from off, tucked towards square leg for a quick single
angled across him and goes past the outside edge. Nicholls was walking into the cover drive, but it whistles past his bat
angled across again, but shorter length, which allows him to stay in his crease and punch it to mid-off
full outside off, driven nicely to long-off
whipped off his legs to the deep square leg fence.Too full, and completely wrong line. Taylor can pick those off his pads all day
fuller ball outside off that time, Taylor steers it to point's right and some hard running gives them two

too wide outside off, Taylor wants to square drive it, but it takes the bottom edge and goes past the stumps to the fine leg fence. Raises his 44th ODI fifty. Perhaps not the most convincing shot to get there, but he's been in an attacking mood today and it's mostly come off
nothing iffy about that boundary! too wide outside off and Taylor throws his bat at it, slaps it to point's left and to the fence
the batsman has forced that wide. A rattled Malinga drags this down too short and too wide
back of a length outside off, Taylor cuts powerfully but straight to point
good length on the stumps, tucked off his pads to deep midwicket
sliced it to long-off He's kept his line very tight has Thisara. Taylor wanted to whip this to his favourite cow corner area, but ends up slicing it for long-off to accept a simple catch.
fullish on the stumps, still a tight line and he can only tap it down to long-off
bouncer outside off, but the umpire calls it a wide. Tad harsh I think.
good length on the stumps, pushed to long-on to get off the mark in ODIs
back of a length but doesn't give room to free arms. He clears his front leg to swat it down to long-off
good length on off, coming back into him a bit. nudged to midwicket
dropped by Sandakan at mid-on another slower ball, chipped in the air to Sandakan. He got both hands to it, but dropped it tumbling forward. Wasn't a difficult catch
another slower ball, too early into the drive and chips it in the air. It's just clear of a diving cover
another full toss, that is not a no-ball but was perilously close to being on. Ends up dipping on the batsman but is down leg, and Seifert manages to get bat on it to send it to the fine leg fence
good length outside off, he comes forward to push it between cover and extra cover
back of a length on the stumps, he gives himself room and slaps it past point

strays down leg and is paddled to fine leg. All of his balls this over have been between 115 and 120 kph. I guess it makes sense against two men who haven't faced him much, and for whom picking his slower one will be difficult
mis-field at the deep midwicket boundary with two men near the ball. Full toss was pulled powerfully right between them. They got there but fumbled
yorker on middle, inside-edged onto the pad. The ball rolls back down the pitch
back of a length and bounces outside off, Seifert, having stepped away outside leg, slashes and misses
full and on the pads, glanced to square leg for a hard-run two

full-toss on leg stump, Seifert can't put it away. Off the thigh pad and rolls back down the pitch. Thisara swoops in on the ball in front of his followthrough. Nicholls wanders out of the crease and looks for the strike. Seifert, the debutant, isn't interested in a single, which results in a mix-up. Thisara turns around and nails the stumps at his end to catch Nicholls waaaaaay short
nice, inswinging yorker, squeezed back past the bowler
caught at long-on another 115 kph ball, Seifert cleared his front leg to swat it, didn't get hold of it and it just went straight to long-on. Not a very successful debut with the bat for him

mis-times another slower one over the bowler's head. goes off the toe-end of the bat. Kusal Perera ran around from long-on, and ended up over-running the ball after it had bounced. Saved himself mighty embarrassment by scrambling back and pulling it in before it went for a boundary
another slower ball, flicked into the leg side
slower ball again. Henry didn't read it, but stays in his crease and dabbed it into the off side
back of a length slower ball that time, and he stays in his crease to cut it past point. I'm wondering if these should be classified as slower balls, given that's all Malinga's been bowling.
swing and a miss. Length ball outside off, at 113.5 kph, he clears his leg to send it to cow corner. Misses entirely. The ball also misses off stump
in the slot and bang a rare bad ball by Thisara, perfectly in Neesham's arc. He picks it up from off and sends it flat over cow corner

similar ball, same result he's losing his length and line against the left-hander, been so good to the right-handers. In the slot again and Neesham sends it exactly over the same spot at cow corner for another six
Neesham's on fire Thisara goes straighter, but still doesn't get the line right. Too full, and Neesham clears his leg to swat it back over the bowler's head and into the sight-screen
ho ho ho, who says Christmas is over Thisara is losing the plot. Full toss outside off that time and Neesham clobbers it over cow corner once again.

full toss and no-ball for being above waist height There's a free hit coming up, and New Zealand have 27 runs off the first four balls! That was outside off, and Neesham swung hard at it, but it went only to mid-off

good god, someone give Thisara some brandy or something to recover too full again and Neesham can't put a foot wrong. That's gone on the roof. I miss Tony Greig on air, who would have done justice to a ball going on the roof and a fifth six off five legal balls in the over. Amazing. Incredible

no six sixes. managed to not get it quite as that full 'in the arc, out of the park' length. Neesham still smashed it, but didn't get the elevation. sends it flat to midwicket, but the good news is, he's retained the strike
fuller on leg stump, he flicks it to fine leg and they run hard to get two and keep Neesham on strike
slower ball, on the stumps, he goes back and whips it to deep square leg. Only a single
yorker, but he steps away and clobbers it to midwicket off his toes. Places it so well that it's gone to the boundary

top edge caught at short fine leg good bouncer, and Henry tries to pull but is too late on it, the top edge swirls to short fine leg where it's comfortably caught. They've crossed though, so Neesham is back on strike
fuller on the stumps, and he swings at it hard but doesn't get the height. The ball travels to deep square leg. Hard running gives them two

ends it with a flat-batted six over cover What a comeback to the team for James Neesham. He's batted better than he tweets, and that's saying something. Ends with 47 not out off 13 balls. Came down the track and swatted this, to end the innings on a high
pitched up and swings away outside off, driven to the covers off the front foot
Boult hits a hard length outside off, jabbed away in the gap at the covers for one more
really full on middle, patted to the covers again
shortish and swings down leg for a wide
back of a length and outside off, punched up to the covers
back of a length and angling into a little push to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, punched up to mid-off
starts off with a pinpoint yorker on off, jammed to point

There's the Dickscoop. Bring it on, Niroshan. I've seen him scoop Rabada for six. This is v Henry who is nearly as quick. Really full on middle and leg, he gets inside the line and ramps it over the fine leg boundary
he attempts another Dickscoop. But this is very full and wide, he ends up edging it behind to the keeper
very full and wide outside off, Dickwella rolls out the slog and drags the ball over midwicket
low full-toss outside off, whisked away to deep midwicket
back of a length and kicks up outside off, stabbed to cover
overpitched and outside off, driven through the line to the right of mid-off
on a length and outside off, dabbed to point with an open face
full and outside off, guided to cover-point
banged in short and aimed at the chest, dragged to midwicket
leg-stump half-volley, flicked away to deep square leg
banged in short and outside off, Dickwella aims to pull but only half-pulls and half-shovels it away through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Dickwella stays beside the line and stabs it off the outside half between backward point and cover-point
pitched up and wide outside off, reaches out for the ball and lifts it over the covers. Nicely done, Danushka
slower offcutter from Henry, breaks away past the outside edge
very full and outside off, driven down to mid-on
Danushka rides the bounce of a short ball outside off and cuts to deep point
Danushka latches onto a short ball outside off and pulls to deep midwicket
Dickwella backs away, meets a full ball outside off and carves in the air between point and cover
pitched up on off, prodded to point
chipped in the air but to Boult's right to mid-off
short on the hips, deflected away to fine leg
full and outside off, inside-edged to midwicket off the front foot
Has Seifert dropped it? Short and swerving down leg, misses the bat, misses the glove, hits the ribs and dips on the keeper
yorker, swings down leg, for a wide
on a length and angling into off, Danushka gets behind the line and plays it back to the bowler
good length on off, played back to the bowler
Dickwella backs away, Henry chases him and tucks him up, stabbed to mid-off
shortish and angling away outside off, run away to point
pitches outside leg, pings the thigh pad, and rolls away to the off side
banged in short and angling away outside off, Danushka splices it in the air. Munro runs around to his right, slides awkwardly, and doesn't get to the ball in the end
pitched up and outside off, sweetly driven to the right of mid-off
short and straightens away outside off, punched up through cover-point. Guptill chases hard, slides, and hauls the ball in. Well done
on a length and holds its line outside off, guided away to third man
on a length and outside off, helped to point with soft hands
chest-high short ball on middle, cramps the batsman for room, fended off
banged in short and outside off, Dickwella jabs a pull only as far as midwicket
Dickwella backs away outside leg and sends an outside edge fine of Ferguson at third man. 50 opening stand for SL
on a length and outside off, there comes the Dickscoop but he can't connect with the ball
full-toss on middle, Dickwella ventures outside leg and taps it in the gap at the covers
back of a length and outside off, whipped across the line to midwicket
very full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
short on off, fended back to the bowler
Danushka rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and runs it down to third man
banged in short and takes off like a rocket and flies past the bat en route to Seifert
short and outside off, guided away to third man
Shot, Niroshan! He rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and ramps it in the air fine of deep third man. Excellent execution
slower ball, floated on middle and leg, nurdled to midwicket
off-stump yorker, dug out to the covers
lifter outside off, too high and called a wide
back of a length and outside off, Dickwella aims to slog it into oblivion. But only connects with thin air
very full and sprayed on the pads, 144.2ks, Danushka uses the pace of the bowler and glances it fine enough for four
short at the body, 144.5ks, tickled to short fine leg. Ferguson gets away with this wayward delivery
short and outside off, hops, opens the face and glides it to point
nice and full on off, 148.3ks, tapped to mid-off
Dickwella backs away outside leg, Ferguson follows him with a 147ks rocket that lands on his pads
banged in short at the body, 146.4ks, deflected away. Seifert throws himself to his right and saves a four
drifting into the pads, feeds Dickwella's strength, paddled away to fine leg
full and straight, worked away to the left of the leg umpire
back of a length and skids on outside off, goes on the back foot and slaps to point
tossed down the leg side, Dickwella sweeps it merrily to fine leg
dragged down outside off, pulled away to deep square leg off the back foot
half-tracker on middle, pulled only as far as deep midwicket
Ferguson hits a hard length, 146ks, cramps the batsman for room and forces him to fend it away to the leg side
on a length and just a shade outside off, patted to the covers
Dickwella takes on a short ball outside off and pulls it away to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and skids in at 145.3ks to smack the thigh pad as Danushka is hurried into a pull
146ks short ball from Ferguson. Kicks up at the body, he top-edges a pull. The ball lands in front of deep square leg
full-toss outside off, creamed to sweeper cover off the front foot
Dickwella uses his feet, meets this pitch of this full ball on middle and bunts it down to long-on
flat and on the pads, whisked away to the midwicket region
lobbed down the leg side, wide
darted on the pads, glanced away behind square on the leg side
pushed through on the pads, turns in, swept away behind square
wrong'un, breaks away outside off, bounces and zips past the outside edge of Danushka
dragged down on middle, pulled off the back foot, there's protection at deep square leg
short and speared down leg, tickled away fine past the diving Seifert for four
very full and outside off, 147.5ks, swings and inside-edges it onto the pad
back of a length and outside off, 146.6ks, guided to third man for one
Oh man, another inventive shot from Dickwella! Banged in short and outside off, Dickwella uses all the pace of Ferguson, arches his back and ramps it over third man and brings up his fifty in style
overpitched and outside off, driven away to sweeper cover
banged in short and aimed at the head of Danushka, he ducks under it
good length and breaks back in, punched away to long-on
tossed on middle, driven to the covers
speared on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg
short and keeps low outside off, Dickwella drags a back-foot pull to deep midwicket. That's the 100 opening stand between Dickwella and Danushka
wrong'un but it's short, allowing the batsman to punch to the covers off the back foot
dragged down on middle, plenty of short balls from Sodhi today, this is hoicked away to deep midwicket
nice and full outside off, 136.4ks, opens the face and drives to cover
full and wide, backs away and blitzes it to extra cover, where Taylor tumbles and stops the ball to his right
full and outside off, hoicked away off the inside half to midwicket fence
full and outside off, stabbed to the covers
fuller on middle and leg, defended back
short and outside off, Neesham finds extra bounce and beats the batsman
full on middle, there comes the reverse-sweep. Swatted away through point
conventional sweep now, not middled as the ball trickles through square leg
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler's right
1000 ODI runs for Danushka. Tossed outside off, driven through the line to long-off
tosses a wrong'un outside leg, turns away, catches the pad. Pitching outside, of course
fired just outside leg, swept flat and hard to deep square leg
fuller ball on off, takes the inside edge onto pad off an attempted drive
Neesham gets some of his own medicine! In the slot for a free swing of the arms, and Dickwella deposits this straight back over the bowler for maximum
top edge falls safe Short ball got big on him, and took the top edge off his attempted pull from outside off. But no one at square leg. Seifert runs across and dives but the ball is out of reach

Neesham can do no wrong! strangled down the leg side, and he tickles it fine, where the keeper makes no mistake. Length ball down leg, and he'll be disappointed at getting out in that fashion after doing the hard work. New Zealand have the first breakthrough
fuller length outside off, he doesn't pick up the slower one, goes for the drive and is beaten
fuller length outside off again, driven firmly but straight to point
angling in on a fullish length, pushed towards mid-on with a straight bat
brilliantly done length ball outside off, moving a touch away, he uses the pace of the ball to late cut it fine to the third man boundary
length ball outside off, he moves across to work it to deep midwicket
slows it down a bit, fullish and angling in on the stumps, he waits for it and punches to deep cover
he's taking the pace off the ball. Length ball on off stump, tucked to midwicket by closing the bat face
he misses out on a full toss, seemed to dip on him a bit. Tried to flick it but doesn't connect, except for an inside edge onto pad

it's just Neesham's day late on it, hung on the back foot to a fuller ball outside off, ends up chopping it on the stumps while going for the drive. The man driving the chase has gone, but it's been a brilliant innings. It's up to the rest of the line-up to continue the good work now
strays on the pads and he's flicked it to deep square leg
back of a length on off, pushed into the off side
latches on to the short ball, swivels and pulls with great timing and balance to send this screaming to the square leg fence
fuller and wider outside off, flat-batted through cover
very full on off stump, low full toss, he jabs it towards mid-off
good length on off, bounces a bit more than expected, squirted away towards point off a thick outside edge. Caught the high part of the bat
good length outside off again, 142.3 clicks. Defended watchfully
too full and on middle stump, whipped away with exquisite timing to the midwicket boundary
good length, but straying on the pads again, turned to fine leg
very full from around the wicket, driven crisply but can't go past mid-off
back of a length outside off, steered to point
too far down leg side and it'll be a wide
length ball on leg stump, tucked to deep midwicket
back of a length, on the sixth stump line, he goes for a big drive, swing and a miss
back of a length rising up to near chest high and coming into him, he goes on the back foot and drops it on the off side for a quick single
fuller length on off stump, he presents a dead-straight bat in defence
too straight, ends up on the pads, and is flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length and coming into the batsman, who stays in his crease, transfers weight back and cuts it for a single
short ball on the stumps, he pulls off the back foot to deep square leg
good length outside off, he pushes it into the offside for a quick single. Guptill ran in quickly from cover and tried to throw the stumps down while diving forward, but missed
too short, sat up and he pulls it in front of square. Was in the air for a bit, but safe
another short ball, and he gets hold of this one. Sat up and was waiting to be hit, and he obliged, pulling off the front foot to send it between midwicket and long-on for a boundary
hits a better length, more full and homing in on the stumps. The batsman's beaten on the drive, due to the pace, and inside edges onto pad
too much room outside off, length ball and he slashes it hard and true, to the cover fence. Sri Lanka keeping pace with the chase
fuller length on off, and defended back with a straight bat from the crease
back of a length outside off, gets it to bounce a bit, but Mendis is equal to it, running it down to third man
length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
good length, going across him, pushed to cover
inside edge goes for four fuller outside off, he wanted to crash it through cover, ends up getting a thin edge that misses the stumps and goes to the fine leg boundary

clobbered went for the bouncer outside off, it didn't rise above the chest and Perera was quickly on to it. Great bat speed, bringing it up and smashing it to the midwicket boundary off a front-foot pull
drifts down leg and is paddled, but there is a short fine leg to stop it
tossed up outside off, he comes forward to take it on the half-volley and works it to midwicket
googly, turning across the batsman from a good length on leg stump. He moves back and clips it to square leg
flatter and skids on a bit, punched from the crease to wide long-on

run out chance missed at the non-striker's end another wrong un, pushed to mid-off and Henry Nicholls has one stump to aim at, misses while running in, collecting the ball while diving forward and flicking it to the stumps
good length outside off, blocked
good length on leg stump, swatted to deep square leg
back of a length on the stumps, coming in a bit, he moves back and tucks it to square leg
beauty flower ball, an off-cutter. He came forward and was all at sea, as it pitched and went past the outside edge
back of a length on leg stump, he shuffles across to clip it to fine leg
back of a length outside off, steered to point off the back foot

back of a length outside off again, he plays it late and gets a thick outside edge to run down to the third man boundary. That seemed deliberate. And the fast outfield means Sodhi at deep square leg had no chance of cutting it off
flatter on leg stump, not much turn, he goes back and across to punch it to long-off

got him off the wrong 'un! good loop, pitches on a perfect length outside off, drawing him forward. Mendis tried to defend, but hadn't read the wrong 'un, or didn't account for how much it would turn. Grips and spins to take the inside edge that balloons up on the leg side behind him, the keeper runs across to complete an easy catch.
tossed up on off stump, too full, turned to deep square leg
flatter googly, too short and turning away to end up outside off. He slaps it hard, but cover fields well
nicely tossed up but outside leg stump and that will be a wide
tossed up on leg stump, and flicked to short fine leg. They take the quick single

googly, and beats Chandimal. Turning in from middle to hit him on the pad. Big appeal but surely going down leg. Even Sodhi think so. But wait! Williamson has gone for a review! Replays show it struck him outside the line of leg stump and was going further down. Why waste a review on that? It's missing leg stump of course
strays on the pads, fuller ball, flicked to deep square leg
good length on the stumps, and defended back to the bowler
good length outside off, he opens the face to steer it, but point dives and saves
short ball, but Perera doesn't get hold of it that time. Went for the pull, as he has done to the short stuff, but was a bit late on it. Strikes him on the body and rolls away towards point
bouncer outside off, that took off well, Chandimal wisely decides to let it go. Would have been in no position to play it, stuck on the crease
back of a length coming into him, steered to third man
tossed up, too full, driven to long-off
flatter on the stumps, and quicker. He moves his front leg out of the way to punch, but straight to cover
googly again, pitching on leg and spinning across him. He moves inside the line to tuck it to fine leg
tossed up, very full again, driven on the full back to the bowler
drags it down short, and Chandimal pulls it. Tried to hit it too hard perhaps, so didn't quite get the timing on it. Deep midwicket fields
that's a bit of a shocker. Lost his line completely and ended up as an offside wide. Well outside the tram lines
tossed up on the leg stump, and turned to fine leg gently enough for them to take two
length ball on the stumps and moving in a bit, clipped to deep square leg
smashed it fuller ball on off, it seemed like the slower one. He picked it beautifully though, stand and deliver swing back past the bowler and into the straight boundary
good length on the stumps, turned towards midwicket
too full and strays in line too. On the pads and all Perera has to do is tickle it fine to collect a boundary
strays on the pads again, on a full length, this time he's clipped to deep square leg
short ball rising up to his head, he stays low and pulls the ball while rolling his wrists. A single to deep midwicket
good length outside off, he stands tall and drives, but Guptill at point dives to his right to intercept
good length, coming back into him. Tried to swivel-pull it but gets an inside edge onto pad
good length angling into the stumps, he stays back and picks it off to deep midwicket
angling into him, back of a length, he flicks it off his hips to fine leg to bring up a fine fifty. 12th in ODIs
fuller ball on the stumps, it was the slower one. Chandimal was a bit too early into the drive past the bowler and the ball hung in the air for a while but was safe.
fuller ball, went for the drive again. Inside edge rolls away onto the leg side
pitched up and angling into off, driven to mid-on for a scampered single
very full and sprayed into the pads from round the wicket, he does not connect with a flick. Off the pad and rolls to the leg side
short and angling into off, kicks up, draws a leading edge but does not carry to cover
slower-ball full-toss outside off, Chandimal reaches out for the ball and drives with a slicing finish to point
very full and nips in on middle, looks like another slower offcutter, clipped away to deep midwicket
slower ball, 121ks outside off, forced down to long-on by Kusal
short and shoved down the leg side for a wide
back of a length, angling in, and straightening away outside off, beats the outside edge
slower offcutter on off, defended back to the bowler
short and outside off, dragged away to deep midwicket

Neesham bounces out Chandimal! Taylor settles under this skier. Looks like a slower offcutter, kicks up at Chandimal, he hooks and top-edges a catch to midwicket. Neesham can't do any wrong today. Buy a lottery ticket today, Neesham!
pitched up and outside off, tapped to short cover
full and angling into the pads, tickled away fine
Kusal rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and fends it away to point
full and into the pads, possibly a slower ball, deflected to the leg side
short and angling into off, Asela shuffles across off and works the ball away square on the leg side
full on middle and leg, another slower cutter, dinked away through the square leg region
banged in short, aimed at the chest, 141ks, hooked away with control to the fine leg boundary
full-toss on leg stump, flicked away to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, tipped to the covers
plays around his front pad and clips it away to long leg
full on the pads, glanced in front of square
banged in short at the body, fended off
slower cutter, moves away outside off, legcutter, beats the batsman and the keeper
short and ducks back in sharply from round the wicket, cuts the batsman into half. Beats the inside edge and bounces over the stumps
on a length and angling in, he eyes up the leg side and gets a leading edge to cover
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and runs it away to point
just short of a good length and outside off, swatted away to long leg
Kusal runs down the track, has a big mow, and does not make contact outside off
short on middle, punched up to the covers
just short of a good length on off, Asela swivels on the back foot and pulls it away to fine leg
very full and angling down the leg side for a wide
on a length and outside off, clipped away to fine leg
Kusal steps away outside leg, Neesham follows him and cramps him for room. He swipes it away to Munro at deep square leg
slower ball outside off, barely 116ks, pushed to the covers
on a length and outside off, defensively nudged to the leg side
another slower ball outside off, 113.4ks, hoodwinks Asela and sneaks under the bat. Replays suggest that was the legcutter
full-toss on off, Asela shuffles across and helps it away to long leg
short on middle, Asela runs down the track and slogs it powerfully to deep midwicket, where Nicholls hunts the ball down
back of a length on the leg stump, Kusal backs away and swings for the hills. The ball only goes as far as long leg

banged in short on the leg stump, Kusal swings for the hills again. Hammered away to deep square leg, where Southee, the sub, leaps for the catch but can only tip it over the boundary. He actually looked to swat it inside the field of play. No dice
accurate yorker on off, Kusal nearly plays on. He shows presence of mind to belatedly wave the ball away from the stumps
short and outside off, hoicked across the line to deep midwicket
short on middle and leg, pulled neatly to fine leg
tossed outside off, knocked away to square leg
skids on off, forced off the back foot to long-on
low full-toss outside off, Asela stretches out and sweeps flat and hard to deep square leg
Kusal expects the googly, be brings out a reverse-sweep. Swatted away over point
spinning into the pads, deflected away through square leg
short and breaking down leg for a wide
skids on off, clipped away to short fine leg off the back foot

on a length and outside off, Kusal ventures down the track. He has a big mow at it and sends a thick outside edge that flies in the air to the left of the keeper. Think that was the slower ball gone wrong
full-toss sprayed on the pads, Boult gets it wrong again, whipped with the wrists through backward square leg for four again
Ferguson stretches his hands to his right in the outfield and saves a boundary. Swatted away like a fly to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, jabbed away to point
rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and guides it away to deep third man
very full and outside off, belted away to the right of Williamson at mid-off
tossed on middle, defended
skids on outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
Asela holes out to deep midwicket. Sodhi loops it up outside off, Asela drags a slog-sweep against the break. Ferguson belatedly moves in and hangs onto the catch
spins into the pads, worked away through square leg
tossed up and spins back in, Thisara nearly plops it back to the bowler
tickled off the pads to fine leg
full and angling into the pads, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball away to long leg
slower ball, legcutter, swerves in, the batsman is early into the flick and cops a blow on the mid-riff
another slower ball, 115ks, on the body, deflected away to the keeper
short of a length and outside off, crunched away to deep midwicket off the back foot
bouncer, angling in on middle, ducks under it

Munro runs back from backward point and tracks down this skier. Ferguson hits a hard length outside off, Thisara aims to club it over the leg side. Instead, he skews it in the air. Munro completes a smart catch to tilt the match in NZ's favour
pushed through on middle, defended away to the leg side
dragged down outside off, slapped off the back foot to sweeper cover
reverse-sweeps and misses outside off
short and fired outside off, cracked off the back foot to sweeper cover
tossed outside off, slogged against the turn between deep midwicket and wide long-on
darted on the pads, knocked to the leg side
very full and wide outside off, inside the tramline, Kusal lets it go
another full, wide one, inside the tramline again, umpire Brown has a look at it. Fair delivery. Kusal had left it alone too
banged in short on the leg stump, Kusal takes it on with a pull and nails the ball over backward square leg
overpitched and outside off, Kusal bludgeons it through extra-cover, beats sweeper to his left, and raises a magnificent century. He keeps SL fighting in this steep chase
full-toss outside off, hacked away to long-off
back of a length and on off, defended to cover
slower short ball outside off, back of the hand variation, 113.7ks, Prasanna picks it up and smites it up and over the midwicket boundary. Bam!
on a length and wide outside off, Prasanna flashes... and misses
very full on off, knocked away in front of long-on
short and shoved down the leg side for a wide
short and outside off, punched up to point
very full and angling into the pads, swings and inside-edges it to the leg side
very full and snaking in at 141.3ks, he plays around his front pad, but this is heading down the leg side
full-toss outside off, cracked away to sweeper cover

Seifert the debutant calls for this and settles under the skier. Kusal goes and with it SL's hopes. Boult goes full and wide outside off, asking Kusal to reach out for the ball and swing it away. He only top-edges it into the sky. The ball drops into the safe gloves of Seifert. Excellent innings from Kusal nevertheless
yorker, swings in at off, clipped away to long leg
short and bounces outside off as he swings and misses
full and on the stumps, tucked around the corner
short at the body, top-edged over the keeper's head

very full and outside off, was there a deflection to the keeper? If there was a deflection, did it carry to the keeper? Seifert claims the catch. The soft signal from the on-field umpire is out. Over to the TV umpire Illingworth. Sekkuge had swung and inside-edged it behind. Seifert throws himself to his left and it's a clean catch. What an effort from Seifert
very full and outside off, again, Sandakan sends an outside edge to third man
very full on off, poked to third man again
full-toss on off, Malinga backs away outside leg and carves the ball down to third man
shorter and outside off, guided away to point
near yorker on middle, squeezed down to long-on for one
banged in short and bounces through to the keeper as Malinga backs away and misses
very full and nips back in, sneaks under the bat on the way to the keeper
nice and full on off, Sandakan moves away outside leg, flashes and misses. Boult nails the stumps and hastens NZ's victory
yorker on off, jabbed away to point
really full on middle, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
slower full ball on middle, Pradeep spots the change-up. He gets underneath the length and hoists it straight of long on for six
short and rises on middle, fended back to the bowler
on a length and outside off, swished across the line to deep midwicket
Dropped at mid-off. Pretty full on middle, backs away and slices it to Henry, who lets the ball bobble out
dug in short on middle, Malinga sizes it up and smokes it over the midwicket boundary. Some swing of the bat, that
off-stump yorker, dug out
Henry yorks Malinga and seals victory for NZ Pinpoint yorker, hurries under the bat of Malinga and cleans him up
